query.description: If unspentOnly is true, filters response to only include unspent transaction outputs (UTXOs).
If includeScript is true, includes raw script of input or output within returned TXRefs.
If true, includes the confidence attribute (useful for unconfirmed transactions) within returned TXRefs. For more info about this figure, check the Confidence Factor documentation.
Filters response to only include transactions below before height in the blockchain.
Filters response to only include transactions above after height in the blockchain.

limit sets the minimum number of returned TXRefs; there can be less if there are less than limit TXRefs associated with this address, but there can be more in the rare case of more TXRefs in the block at the bottom of your call. This ensures paging by block height never misses TXRefs. Defaults to 200, maximum is 2000.
If set, only returns the balance and TXRefs that have at least this number of confirmations.

Filters response to only include TXRefs above confidence in percent; e.g., if this is set to 99, will only return TXRefs with 99% confidence or above (including all confirmed TXRefs). For more detail on confidence, check the Confidence Factor documentation.
If omitWalletAddresses is true and you’re querying a Wallet or HDWallet, the response will omit address information (useful to speed up the API call for larger wallets).
If omitWalletAddresses is true and you’re querying a Wallet or HDWallet, the response will omit address information (useful to speed up the API call for larger wallets).
Filters response to only include transactions below before height in the blockchain.
Filters response to only include transactions above after height in the blockchain.

limit sets the minimum number of returned TXs; there can be less if there are less than limit TXs associated with this address, but there can also be more in the rare case of more TXs in the block at the bottom of your call. This ensures paging by block height never misses TXs. Defaults to 10, maximum is 50.
This filters the TXInputs/TXOutputs within the returned TXs to include a maximum of txlimit items.
If set, only returns the balance and TXs that have at least this number of confirmations.

Filters response to only include TXs above confidence in percent; e.g., if this is set to 99, will only return TXs with 99% confidence or above (including all confirmed TXs). For more detail on confidence, check the Confidence Factor documentation.
If true, includes hex-encoded raw transaction for each TX; false by default.
If true, includes the confidence attribute (useful for unconfirmed transactions) within returned TXs. For more info about this figure, check the Confidence Factor documentation.
If omitWalletAddresses is true and you’re querying a Wallet or HDWallet, the response will omit address information (useful to speed up the API call for larger wallets).
If private is true, it will return privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, returns public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, returning public data.
Returns list of address forwards starting at the start index; useful for paging beyond the limit of 200 address forwards.
If private is true, it will return privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, returns public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, returning public data.
Filters TXInputs/TXOutputs, if unset, default is 20.
Filters TX to only include TXInputs from this input index and above.
Filters TX to only include TXOutputs from this output index and above.
If true, includes hex-encoded raw transaction; false by default.
If true, includes the confidence attribute (useful for unconfirmed transactions). For more info about this figure, check the Confidence Factor documentation.
If private is true, it will return privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, returns public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, returning public data.
Returns only used addresses if set to true and only unused if false. Only valid on HD wallets.
Returns only addresses with zero balance if set to true and only addresses with non-zero balance if false. Only valid on HD wallets.
Returns only used addresses if set to true and only unused if false. Only valid on HD wallets.
Returns only addresses with zero balance if set to true and only addresses with non-zero balance if false. Only valid on HD wallets.

address.description: Optional The requested address. Not returned if querying a wallet/HD wallet.

total_received.description: Total amount of confirmed satoshis received by this address.

total_sent.description: Total amount of confirmed satoshis sent by this address.

balance.description: Balance of confirmed satoshis on this address. This is the difference between outputs and inputs on this address, but only for transactions that have been included into a block (i.e., for transactions whose confirmations > 0).

unconfirmed_balance.description: Balance of unconfirmed satoshis on this address. Can be negative (if unconfirmed transactions are just spending outputs). Only unconfirmed transactions (haven’t made it into a block) are included.

final_balance.description: Total balance of satoshis, including confirmed and unconfirmed transactions, for this address.

n_tx.description: Number of confirmed transactions on this address. Only transactions that have made it into a block (confirmations > 0) are counted.

unconfirmed_n_tx.description: Number of unconfirmed transactions for this address. Only unconfirmed transactions (confirmations == 0) are counted.

final_n_tx.description: Final number of transactions, including confirmed and unconfirmed transactions, for this address.

tx_url.description: Optional To retrieve base URL transactions. To get the full URL, concatenate this URL with a transaction’s hash.

txs.description: Array of full transaction details associated with this address. Usually only returned from the Address Full Endpoint.

txrefs.description: Optional Array of transaction inputs and outputs for this address. Usually only returned from the standard Address Endpoint.

unconfirmed_txrefs.description: Optional All unconfirmed transaction inputs and outputs for this address. Usually only returned from the standard Address Endpoint.

hasMore.description: Optional If true, then the Address object contains more transactions than shown. Useful for determining whether to poll the API for more transaction information.

wif.description: Wallet import format, a common encoding for the private key.

pubkeys.description: Optional Array of public keys to provide to generate a multisig address.

script_type.description: Optional If generating a multisig address, the type of multisig script; typically “multisig-n-of-m”, where n and m are integers.

original_address.description: Optional If generating an OAP address, this represents the parent blockchain’s underlying address (the typical address listed above).

oap_address.description: Optional The OAP address, if generated using the Generate Asset Address Endpoint.

wif.description: Wallet import format, a common encoding for the private key.

pubkeys.description: Optional Array of public keys to provide to generate a multisig address.

script_type.description: Optional If generating a multisig address, the type of multisig script; typically “multisig-n-of-m”, where n and m are integers.

original_address.description: Optional If generating an OAP address, this represents the parent blockchain’s underlying address (the typical address listed above).

oap_address.description: Optional The OAP address, if generated using the Generate Asset Address Endpoint.

path.description: The BIP32 path of the HD address.

public.description: optional Contains the hex-encoded public key if returned by Derive Address in Wallet endpoint.

chain_addresses.description: Array of HDAddresses associated with this subchain.

index.description: optional Index of the subchain, returned if the wallet has subchains.

token.description: User token associated with this HD wallet.

chains.description: List of HD chains associated with this wallet, each containing HDAddresses. A single chain is returned if the wallet has no subchains.

hd.description: true for HD wallets, not present for normal wallets.

extended_public_key.title: The extended public key all addresses in the HD wallet are derived from. It’s encoded in BIP32 format

subchain_indexes.description: optional returned for HD wallets created with subchains.

block_height.description: Height of the block that contains this transaction. If this is an unconfirmed transaction, it will equal -1.

hash.description: The hash of the transaction. While reasonably unique, using hashes as identifiers may be unsafe.

addresses.description: Array of bitcoin public addresses involved in the transaction.

total.description: The total number of satoshis exchanged in this transaction.

fees.description: The total number of fees—in satoshis—collected by miners in this transaction.

size.description: The size of the transaction in bytes.

preference.description: The likelihood that this transaction will make it to the next block; reflects the preference level miners have to include this transaction. Can be high, medium or low.

relayed_by.description: Address of the peer that sent Block’s servers this transaction.

received.description: Time this transaction was received by Block’s servers.

ver.description: Version number, typically 1 for Bitcoin transactions.

lock_time.description: Time when transaction can be valid. Can be interpreted in two ways: if less than 500 million, refers to block height. If more, refers to Unix epoch time.

double_spend.description: true if this is an attempted double spend; false otherwise.

vin_sz.description: Total number of inputs in the transaction.

vout_sz.description: Total number of outputs in the transaction.

confirmations.description: Number of subsequent blocks, including the block the transaction is in. Unconfirmed transactions have 0 confirmations.

inputs.description: TXInput Array, limited to 20 by default.

outputs.description: TXOutput Array, limited to 20 by default.

opt_in_rbf.description: Optional Returns true if this transaction has opted in to Replace-By-Fee (RBF), either true or not present. You can read more about Opt-In RBF here.

confidence.description: Optional The percentage chance this transaction will not be double-spent against, if unconfirmed. For more information, check the section on Confidence Factor.

confirmed.description: Optional Time at which transaction was included in a block; only present for confirmed transactions.

receive_count.description: Optional Number of peers that have sent this transaction to Block; only present for unconfirmed transactions.

change_address.description: Optional Address Block will use to send back your change, if you constructed this transaction. If not set, defaults to the address from which the coins were originally sent.

block_hash.description: Optional Hash of the block that contains this transaction; only present for confirmed transactions.

block_index.description: Optional Canonical, zero-indexed location of this transaction in a block; only present for confirmed transactions.

double_of.description: Optional If this transaction is a double-spend (i.e. double_spend == true) then this is the hash of the transaction it’s double-spending.

data_protocol.title: Optional Returned if this transaction contains an OP_RETURN associated with a known data protocol. Data protocols currently detected: blockchainid ; openassets ; factom ; colu ; coinspark ; omni

hex.description: Optional Hex-encoded bytes of the transaction, as sent over the network.

next_inputs.description: Optional If there are more transaction inptus that couldn’t fit into the TXInput array, this is the Block URL to query the next set of TXInputs (within a TX object).

next_outputs.description: Optional If there are more transaction outputs that couldn’t fit into the TXOutput array, this is the Block URL to query the next set of TXOutputs(within a TX object).

prev_hash.description: The previous transaction hash where this input was an output. Not present for coinbase transactions.

output_index.description: The index of the output being spent within the previous transaction. Not present for coinbase transactions.

output_value.description: The value of the output being spent within the previous transaction. Not present for coinbase transactions.

script_type.description: The type of script that encumbers the output corresponding to this input.

script.description: Raw hexadecimal encoding of the script.

addresses.description: An array of public addresses associated with the output of the previous transaction.

sequence.description: Legacy 4-byte sequence number, not usually relevant unless dealing with locktime encumbrances.

age.description: Optional Number of confirmations of the previous transaction for which this input was an output. Currently, only returned in unconfirmed transactions.

wallet_name.description: Optional Name of Wallet or HDWallet from which to derive inputs. Only used when constructing transactions via the Creating Transactions process.

wallet_token.description: Optional Token associated with Wallet or HDWallet used to derive inputs. Only used when constructing transactions via the Creating Transactions process.

value.description: Value in this transaction output, in satoshis.

script.description: Raw hexadecimal encoding of the encumbrance script for this output.

addresses.description: Addresses that correspond to this output; typically this will only have a single address, and you can think of this output as having “sent” value to the address contained herein.

script_type.description: The type of encumbrance script used for this output.

spent_by.description: Optional The transaction hash that spent this output. Only returned for outputs that have been spent. The spending transaction may be unconfirmed.

data_hex.description: Optional A hex-encoded representation of an OP_RETURN data output, without any other script instructions. Only returned for outputs whose script_type is null-data.

data_string.description: Optional An ASCII representation of an OP_RETURN data output, without any other script instructions. Only returned for outputs whose script_type is null-data and if its data falls into the visible ASCII range.

address.description: Optional The address associated with this transaction input/output. Only returned when querying an address endpoint via a wallet/HD wallet name.

block_height.description: Height of the block that contains this transaction input/output. If it’s unconfirmed, this will equal -1.

tx_hash.description: The hash of the transaction containing this input/output. While reasonably unique, using hashes as identifiers may be unsafe.

tx_input_n.description: Index of this input in the enclosing transaction. It’s a negative number for an output.

tx_output_n.description: Index of this output in the enclosing transaction. It’s a negative number for an input.

value.description: The value transfered by this input/output in satoshis exchanged in the enclosing transaction.

preference.description: The likelihood that the enclosing transaction will make it to the next block; reflects the preference level miners have to include the enclosing transaction. Can be high, medium or low.

spent.description: true if this is an output and was spent. If it’s an input, or an unspent output, it will be false.

double_spend.description: true if this is an attempted double spend; false otherwise.

confirmations.description: Number of subsequent blocks, including the block the transaction is in. Unconfirmed transactions have 0 confirmations.

script.description: Optional Raw, hex-encoded script of this input/output.

ref_balance.description: Optional The past balance of the parent address the moment this transaction was confirmed. Not present for unconfirmed transactions.

confidence.description: Optional The percentage chance this transaction will not be double-spent against, if unconfirmed. For more information, check the section on Confidence Factor.

confirmed.description: Optional Time at which transaction was included in a block; only present for confirmed transactions.

spent_by.description: Optional The transaction hash that spent this output. Only returned for outputs that have been spent. The spending transaction may be unconfirmed.

received.description: Optional Time this transaction was received by Block’s servers; only present for unconfirmed transactions.

receive_count.description: Optional Number of peers that have sent this transaction to Block; only present for unconfirmed transactions.

double_of.description: Optional If this transaction is a double-spend (i.e. double_spend == true) then this is the hash of the transaction it’s double-spending.

token.description: User token associated with this wallet.

addresses.description: List of addresses associated with this wallet.

id.description: Identifier of the address forwarding request; generated when a new request is created.

destination.description: The required destination address for address forwarding.

input_address.description: The address which will automatically forward to destination; generated when a new request is created.

process_fees_address.description: Optional Address to forward processing fees, if specified. Allows you to receive a fee for your own services.

process_fees_satoshis.description: Optional Fixed processing fee amount to be sent to the fee address. A fixed satoshi amount or a percentage is required if a process_fees_address has been specified.

process_fees_percent.description: Optional Percentage of the transaction to be sent to the fee address. A fixed satoshi amount or a percentage is required if a process_fees_address has been specified.

callback_url.description: Optional The URL to call anytime a new is forwarded.

enable_confirmations.description: Optional Whether to also call the callback_url with subsequent confirmations of the forwarding transactions. Automatically sets up a WebHook.

mining_fees_satoshis.description: Optional Mining fee amount to include in the forwarding transaction, in satoshis. If not set, defaults to 10,000.

txs.description: Optional History of forwarding transaction hashes for this address forward; not present if this request has yet to forward any transactions.

id.description: Identifier of the address forwarding request; generated when a new request is created.

destination.description: The required destination address for address forwarding.

input_address.description: The address which will automatically forward to destination; generated when a new request is created.

process_fees_address.description: Optional Address to forward processing fees, if specified. Allows you to receive a fee for your own services.

process_fees_satoshis.description: Optional Fixed processing fee amount to be sent to the fee address. A fixed satoshi amount or a percentage is required if a process_fees_address has been specified.

process_fees_percent.description: Optional Percentage of the transaction to be sent to the fee address. A fixed satoshi amount or a percentage is required if a process_fees_address has been specified.

callback_url.description: Optional The URL to call anytime a new is forwarded.

enable_confirmations.description: Optional Whether to also call the callback_url with subsequent confirmations of the forwarding transactions. Automatically sets up a WebHook.

mining_fees_satoshis.description: Optional Mining fee amount to include in the forwarding transaction, in satoshis. If not set, defaults to 10,000.

txs.description: Optional History of forwarding transaction hashes for this address forward; not present if this request has yet to forward any transactions.

address.description: Address hash this job is querying.

start.description: Beginning of time range to query.

end.description: End of time range to query.

source.title: IP address and port, of the form “0.0.0.0:80”. Ideally an IP and port combination found from another API lookup (for example, relayed_by from the Transaction Hash Endpoint)

token.description: The token that created this job.

analytics_engine.description: The engine used for the job query.

created_at.description: The time this job was created.

completed_at.description: Optional When this job was completed; only present on complete jobs.

finished.description: true if this job is finished processing, false otherwise.

started.description: true if this job has begun processing, false otherwise.

ticket.description: Unique identifier for this job, used to get job status and results.

result_path.description: ptional URL to query job results; only present on complete jobs.

address.description: Address hash this job is querying.

start.description: Beginning of time range to query.

end.description: End of time range to query.

source.title: IP address and port, of the form “0.0.0.0:80”. Ideally an IP and port combination found from another API lookup (for example, relayed_by from the Transaction Hash Endpoint)

more.description: true if there are more results in a separate page; false otherwise.

next_page.description: Optional URL to get the next page of results; only present if there are more results to show.

results.description: Results of analytics job; structure of results are dependent on engine-type of query, but are generally either strings of address hashes or JSON objects.

from_private.description: The private key being used to issue or transfer assets.

to_address.description: The target OAP address assets for issue or transfer.

amount.description: The amount of assets being issued or transfered.

metadata.description: Optional Hex-encoded metadata that can optionally be encoded into the issue or transfer transaction.

ver.description: Version of Open Assets Protocol transaction. Typically 1.

assetid.description: Unique indentifier associated with this asset; can be used to query other transactions associated with this asset.

hash.description: This transaction’s unique hash; same as the underlying transaction on the asset’s parent blockchain.

confirmed.description: Optional Time this transaction was confirmed; only returned for confirmed transactions.

oap_meta.description: Optional Associated hex-encoded metadata with this transaction, if it exists.

double_spend.description: true if this is an attempted double spend; false otherwise.

inputs.description: Array of input data, which can be seen explicitly in the cURL example. Very similar to array of TXInputs, but with values related to assets instead of satoshis.

outputs.description: Array of output data, which can be seen explicitly in the cURL example. Very similar to array of TXOutputs, but with values related to assets instead of satoshis.

from_private.description: The private key being used to issue or transfer assets.

to_address.description: The target OAP address assets for issue or transfer.

amount.description: The amount of assets being issued or transfered.

metadata.description: Optional Hex-encoded metadata that can optionally be encoded into the issue or transfer transaction.

hash.title: The hash of the block; in Bitcoin, the hashing function is SHA256(SHA256(block))

height.description: The height of the block in the blockchain; i.e., there are height earlier blocks in its blockchain.

depth.description: The depth of the block in the blockchain; i.e., there are depth later blocks in its blockchain.

network.title: The name of the blockchain represented, in the form of $COIN.$CHAIN

total.description: The total number of satoshis transacted in this block.

fees.description: The total number of fees—in satoshis—collected by miners in this block.

size.description: Optional Raw size of block (including header and all transactions) in bytes. Not returned for bitcoin blocks earlier than height 389104.

time.description: Recorded time at which block was built. Note: Miners rarely post accurate clock times.

received_time.description: The time Block’s servers receive the block. Our servers’ clock is continuously adjusted and accurate.

relayed_by.description: Address of the peer that sent Block’s servers this block.

nonce.description: The number used by a miner to generate this block.

n_tx.description: Number of transactions in this block.

prev_block.description: The hash of the previous block in the blockchain.

prev_block_url.description: The Block URL to query for more information on the previous block.

tx_url.description: The base Block URL to receive transaction details. To get more details about specific transactions, you must concatenate this URL with the desired transaction hash(es).

mrkl_root.description: The Merkle root of this block.

txids.description: An array of transaction hashes in this block. By default, only 20 are included.

next_txids.description: Optional If there are more transactions that couldn’t fit in the txids array, this is the Block URL to query the next set of transactions (within a Block object).

name.description: The name of the blockchain represented, in the form of $COIN.$CHAIN.

height.description: The current height of the blockchain; i.e., the number of blocks in the blockchain.

hash.description: The hash of the latest confirmed block in the blockchain; in Bitcoin, the hashing function is SHA256(SHA256(block)).

time.description: The time of the latest update to the blockchain; typically when the latest block was added.

latest_url.description: The Block URL to query for more information on the latest confirmed block; returns a Block.

previous_hash.description: The hash of the second-to-latest confirmed block in the blockchain.

previous_url.description: The Block URL to query for more information on the second-to-latest confirmed block; returns a Block.

high_fee_per_kb.description: A rolling average of the fee (in satoshis) paid per kilobyte for transactions to be confirmed within 1 to 2 blocks.

medium_fee_per_kb.description: A rolling average of the fee (in satoshis) paid per kilobyte for transactions to be confirmed within 3 to 6 blocks.

low_fee_per_kb.description: A rolling average of the fee (in satoshis) paid per kilobyte for transactions to be confirmed in 7 or more blocks.

unconfirmed_count.description: Number of unconfirmed transactions in memory pool (likely to be included in next block).

last_fork_height.description: Optional The current height of the latest fork to the blockchain; when no competing blockchain fork present, not returned with endpoints that return Blockchains.

last_fork_hash.description: Optional The hash of the latest confirmed block in the latest fork of the blockchain; when no competing blockchain fork present, not returned with endpoints that return Blockchains.

age_millis.description: The age of the transaction in milliseconds, based on the earliest time BlockCypher saw it relayed in the network.

receive_count.description: Number of peers that have sent this transaction to BlockCypher; only positive for unconfirmed transactions. -1 for confirmed transactions.

confidence.description: A number from 0 to 1 representing BlockCypher’s confidence that the transaction won’t be double-spent against.

txhash.description: The hash of the transaction. While reasonably unique, using hashes as identifiers may be unsafe.

txurl.description: The BlockCypher URL one can use to query more detailed information about this transaction.

private.description: If private is true, it will set/update privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, sets public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, setting public metadata.
If private is true, it will set/update privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, sets public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, setting public metadata.
If private is true, it will set/update privately stored metadata under your token. Otherwise, sets public metadata. If not set, it defaults to false, setting public metadata.

from_pubkey.description: Hex-encoded public key from which you’re sending coins.

from_private.description: Hex-encoded private key from which you’re sending coins.

from_wif.description: WIF-encoded private key from which you’re sending coins.

to_address.description: The target address to which you’re sending coins.

value_satoshis.description: Value you’re sending/you’ve sent in satoshis.

change_address.description: Optional Address Block will use to send back your change. If not set, defaults to the address from which the coins were originally sent. While not required, we recommend that you set a change address.

wait_guarantee.description: Optional If not set, defaults to true, which means the API will wait for Block to guarantee the transaction, using our Confidence Factor. The guarantee usually takes around 8 seconds. If manually set to false, the Microtransaction endpoint will return as soon as the transaction is broadcast.

tosign.description: Optional Hex-encoded data for you to sign after initiating the microtransaction. Sent in reply to a microtransaction generated using from_pubkey/a public key.

signatures.description: Optional Hex-encoded signatures for you to send back after having received (and signed) tosign.

inputs.description: Optional Partial list of inputs that will be used with this transaction. Inputs themsleves are heavily pared down, see cURL sample. Only returned when using from_pubkey.

outputs.description: Optional Partial list of outputs that will be used with this transaction. Outputs themselves are heavily pared down, see cURL sample. Only returned when using from_pubkey.

fees.description: Optional Block’s optimally calculated fees for this MicroTX to guarantee swift 99% confirmation, only returned when using from_pubkey. Block pays these fees for the first 8,000 microtransactions, but like regular transactions, it is deducted from the source address thereafter.

hash.description: Optional The hash of the finalized transaction, once sent.

from_pubkey.description: Hex-encoded public key from which you’re sending coins.

from_private.description: Hex-encoded private key from which you’re sending coins.

from_wif.description: WIF-encoded private key from which you’re sending coins.

to_address.description: The target address to which you’re sending coins.

value_satoshis.description: Value you’re sending/you’ve sent in satoshis.

change_address.description: Optional Address Block will use to send back your change. If not set, defaults to the address from which the coins were originally sent. While not required, we recommend that you set a change address.

wait_guarantee.description: Optional If not set, defaults to true, which means the API will wait for Block to guarantee the transaction, using our Confidence Factor. The guarantee usually takes around 8 seconds. If manually set to false, the Microtransaction endpoint will return as soon as the transaction is broadcast.

tosign.description: Optional Hex-encoded data for you to sign after initiating the microtransaction. Sent in reply to a microtransaction generated using from_pubkey/a public key.

signatures.description: Optional Hex-encoded signatures for you to send back after having received (and signed) tosign.

inputs.description: Optional Partial list of inputs that will be used with this transaction. Inputs themsleves are heavily pared down, see cURL sample. Only returned when using from_pubkey.

outputs.description: Optional Partial list of outputs that will be used with this transaction. Outputs themselves are heavily pared down, see cURL sample. Only returned when using from_pubkey.

fees.description: Optional Block’s optimally calculated fees for this MicroTX to guarantee swift 99% confirmation, only returned when using from_pubkey. Block pays these fees for the first 8,000 microtransactions, but like regular transactions, it is deducted from the source address thereafter.

hash.description: Optional The hash of the finalized transaction, once sent.

block_height.description: Height of the block that contains this transaction. If this is an unconfirmed transaction, it will equal -1.

hash.description: The hash of the transaction. While reasonably unique, using hashes as identifiers may be unsafe.

addresses.description: Array of bitcoin public addresses involved in the transaction.

total.description: The total number of satoshis exchanged in this transaction.

fees.description: The total number of fees—in satoshis—collected by miners in this transaction.

size.description: The size of the transaction in bytes.

preference.description: The likelihood that this transaction will make it to the next block; reflects the preference level miners have to include this transaction. Can be high, medium or low.

relayed_by.description: Address of the peer that sent Block’s servers this transaction.

received.description: Time this transaction was received by Block’s servers.

ver.description: Version number, typically 1 for Bitcoin transactions.

lock_time.description: Time when transaction can be valid. Can be interpreted in two ways: if less than 500 million, refers to block height. If more, refers to Unix epoch time.

double_spend.description: true if this is an attempted double spend; false otherwise.

vin_sz.description: Total number of inputs in the transaction.

vout_sz.description: Total number of outputs in the transaction.

confirmations.description: Number of subsequent blocks, including the block the transaction is in. Unconfirmed transactions have 0 confirmations.

inputs.description: TXInput Array, limited to 20 by default.

outputs.description: TXOutput Array, limited to 20 by default.

opt_in_rbf.description: Optional Returns true if this transaction has opted in to Replace-By-Fee (RBF), either true or not present. You can read more about Opt-In RBF here.

confidence.description: Optional The percentage chance this transaction will not be double-spent against, if unconfirmed. For more information, check the section on Confidence Factor.

confirmed.description: Optional Time at which transaction was included in a block; only present for confirmed transactions.

receive_count.description: Optional Number of peers that have sent this transaction to Block; only present for unconfirmed transactions.

change_address.description: Optional Address Block will use to send back your change, if you constructed this transaction. If not set, defaults to the address from which the coins were originally sent.

block_hash.description: Optional Hash of the block that contains this transaction; only present for confirmed transactions.

block_index.description: Optional Canonical, zero-indexed location of this transaction in a block; only present for confirmed transactions.

double_of.description: Optional If this transaction is a double-spend (i.e. double_spend == true) then this is the hash of the transaction it’s double-spending.

data_protocol.title: Optional Returned if this transaction contains an OP_RETURN associated with a known data protocol. Data protocols currently detected: blockchainid ; openassets ; factom ; colu ; coinspark ; omni

hex.description: Optional Hex-encoded bytes of the transaction, as sent over the network.

next_inputs.description: Optional If there are more transaction inptus that couldn’t fit into the TXInput array, this is the Block URL to query the next set of TXInputs (within a TX object).

next_outputs.description: Optional If there are more transaction outputs that couldn’t fit into the TXOutput array, this is the Block URL to query the next set of TXOutputs(within a TX object).

data.description: The string representing the data to embed, can be either hex-encoded or plaintext.

token.description: Optional Your BlockCypher API token, can either be included here or as a URL Parameter in your request.

encoding.description: Optional The encoding of your data, can be either string (for plaintext) or hex (for hex-encoded). If not set, defaults to hex.

hash.description: Optional The hash of the transaction containing your data; only part of return object.

data.description: The string representing the data to embed, can be either hex-encoded or plaintext.

token.description: Optional Your BlockCypher API token, can either be included here or as a URL Parameter in your request.

encoding.description: Optional The encoding of your data, can be either string (for plaintext) or hex (for hex-encoded). If not set, defaults to hex.

hash.description: Optional The hash of the transaction containing your data; only part of return object.

tosign.description: Array of hex-encoded data for you to sign, one for each input.

signatures.description: Array of signatures corresponding to all the data in tosign, typically provided by you.

pubkeys.description: Array of public keys corresponding to each signature. In general, these are provided by you, and correspond to the signatures you provide.

tosign_tx.description: Optional Array of hex-encoded, work-in-progress transactions; optionally returned to validate the tosign data locally.

errors.description: Optional Array of errors in the form “error”:“description-of-error”. This is only returned if there was an error in any stage of transaction generation, and is usually accompanied by a HTTP 400 code.

transaction.description: The hash of the transaction you queried.

first_city.description: Optional The name of the city closest to the first_location. If no nearby city can be found, this is not returned.

first_country.description: The name of the country containing the first_location.

aggregated_origin_radius.description: The radius (in meters) of the smallest circle containing the first peer from which we detect this transaction, the average of the first five peers, and the average of the first ten peers. In a general sense, this represents an approximate confidence interval in our calculated aggregated_origin; the smaller the radius, the more confidence in our aggregated_origin assessment.

first_received.description: The timestamp when BlockCypher first received this transaction.

tosign.description: Array of hex-encoded data for you to sign, one for each input.

signatures.description: Array of signatures corresponding to all the data in tosign, typically provided by you.

pubkeys.description: Array of public keys corresponding to each signature. In general, these are provided by you, and correspond to the signatures you provide.

tosign_tx.description: Optional Array of hex-encoded, work-in-progress transactions; optionally returned to validate the tosign data locally.

errors.description: Optional Array of errors in the form “error”:“description-of-error”. This is only returned if there was an error in any stage of transaction generation, and is usually accompanied by a HTTP 400 code.

omitWalletAddresses.description: If omitWalletAddresses is true, the response will omit address information (useful to speed up the API call for larger wallets).

count.description: Number of addresses to derive. If not set, default is one address.

subchain_index.description: Derives address(es) on this specific subchain. If not set, address will be generated on the first chain in the HD wallet.

token.description:
--- Wallet ---
User token associated with this wallet.

addresses.description: List of addresses associated with this wallet.

wif.description: Wallet import format, a common encoding for the private key.

pubkeys.description: Optional Array of public keys to provide to generate a multisig address.

script_type.description: Optional If generating a multisig address, the type of multisig script;typically “multisig-n-of-m”, where n and m are integers.

original_address.description: Optional If generating an OAP address, this represents the parent blockchain’s underlying address (the typical address listed above).

oap_address.description: Optional The OAP address, if generated using the Generate Asset Address Endpoint.

id.description: Identifier of the event; generated when a new request is created.

event.description: Type of event; can be unconfirmed-tx, new-block, confirmed-tx, tx-confirmation, double-spend-tx, tx-confidence.

hash.description: optional Only objects with a matching hash will be sent. The hash can either be for a block or a transaction.

wallet_name.description: optional Only transactions associated with the given wallet will be sent; can use a regular or HD wallet name. If used, requires a user token.

token.description: optional Required if wallet_name is used, though generally we advise users to include it (as they can reach API throttling thresholds rapidly).

address.description: optional Only transactions associated with the given address will be sent. A wallet name can also be used instead of an address, which will then match on any address in the wallet.

confirmations.description: optional Used in concert with the tx-confirmation event type to set the number of confirmations desired for which to receive an update. You’ll receive an updated TX for every confirmation up to this amount. The maximum allowed is 10; if not set, it will default to 6.

confidence.description: optional Used in concert with the tx-confidence event type to set the minimum confidence for which you’ll receive a notification. You’ll receive a TX once this threshold is met. Will accept any float between 0 and 1, exclusive; if not set, defaults to 0.99.

script.description: optional Only transactions with an output script of the provided type will be sent. The recognized types of scripts are: pay-to-pubkey-hash, pay-to-multi-pubkey-hash, pay-to-pubkey, pay-to-script-hash, null-data (sometimes called OP_RETURN), empty or unknown.

url.description: optional Callback URL for this Event’s WebHook; not applicable for WebSockets usage.

callback_errors.description: Number of errors when attempting to POST to callback URL; not applicable for WebSockets usage.

id.description: Identifier of the event; generated when a new request is created.

event.description: Type of event; can be unconfirmed-tx, new-block, confirmed-tx, tx-confirmation, double-spend-tx, tx-confidence.

hash.description: optional Only objects with a matching hash will be sent. The hash can either be for a block or a transaction.

wallet_name.description: optional Only transactions associated with the given wallet will be sent; can use a regular or HD wallet name. If used, requires a user token.

token.description: optional Required if wallet_name is used, though generally we advise users to include it (as they can reach API throttling thresholds rapidly).

address.description: optional Only transactions associated with the given address will be sent. A wallet name can also be used instead of an address, which will then match on any address in the wallet.

confirmations.description: optional Used in concert with the tx-confirmation event type to set the number of confirmations desired for which to receive an update. You’ll receive an updated TX for every confirmation up to this amount. The maximum allowed is 10; if not set, it will default to 6.

confidence.description: optional Used in concert with the tx-confidence event type to set the minimum confidence for which you’ll receive a notification. You’ll receive a TX once this threshold is met. Will accept any float between 0 and 1, exclusive; if not set, defaults to 0.99.

script.description: optional Only transactions with an output script of the provided type will be sent. The recognized types of scripts are: pay-to-pubkey-hash, pay-to-multi-pubkey-hash, pay-to-pubkey, pay-to-script-hash, null-data (sometimes called OP_RETURN), empty or unknown.

url.description: optional Callback URL for this Event’s WebHook; not applicable for WebSockets usage.

callback_errors.description: Number of errors when attempting to POST to callback URL; not applicable for WebSockets usage.

description.content: Welcome to Chainweaver's API documentation!\n All API calls are versioned and the current BlockCypher API is v1. The BlockCypher Ethereum API is currently in beta, and we hope not to introduce any breaking changes, but until it’s out of beta we can’t make that guarantee until it’s stable.
